185532554.review:
[h3]If you are looking for a videogame simulation concerning the movie Aliens, this is it, intestinal parasites and all![/h3]
If you are a creature of impeccable taste you are aware of the fact that the life and struggle of the colonial marines in the second Alien installment is the far superior movie, and one that really cemented the ridiculous notion that we humans are at the top of the intergalactic food chain. In Reactive Drop you get to play a small squad of said marines as you battle through installations, fusion reactors, clandestine laboratories and more to stem the tide of the alien swarm. 
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3397735193 
At its heart this is a tactical top down shooter for 1-8 players that really focuses on tactical squad based gameplay, and best of all, it is completely free! You select one of 4 classes with 2 characters tied to each class and equip your marine with a starting kit of weapons, ammunition, handheld welders and other things that might aid you on your mission. On the way you get to hack terminals, seal doors, set up sentries at chokepoints and generally LARP your way through a set of atmospheric maps and campaigns that truly do the gameplay fantasy justice. The difficulty is highly modifiable and comes with a plethora of options to make your run as smooth or nail biting as you want. 
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=3397735042 
I have no critique whatsoever and since this is a free game with the power of the steam workshop attached to it there is a ton of content to play through and enjoy. Round off a few friends, shoulder that pulse rifle and have a blast while trying not to gun down your own crew in a frantic hunt for the last parasite trying to suck your delicious brains out.

185277354.review:
8 / 10 
Completed 8 different campaigns so far (on Normal Mode), some with my friends. This can be thought of as a video game version of STARSHIP TROOPERS.

GOODS
--- Action packed and quite tactical, I enjoyed the campaigns in Single Player mode (with AI allies who you can switch with and co-ordinate) and in Co-Op online mode.
--- Excellent and smooth control mechanics with Keyboard and Mouse.
--- Very good presentation (for the most part) with good graphics and animations.
--- Dabbled with a few levels on harder difficulties, and I found them tough. I like a challenge every now and then.
--- It’s a FREE GAME!!!

MIXED FEELINGS
--- There are some different kinds of enemies, but I think there should’ve been a bit more variety. A lot of the selection of aliens are mostly the same in the different campaigns, and most of the enemies you massacre through are the same clawed faced aliens.
--- Some variety in environments, the level designs are reasonable varied, good sense of verticality in some of the levels too. But it could’ve been expanded more.
--- Chainsaw with infinite fuel is overpowered, lol. Pop goes the aliens!!! I deliberately avoid using it unless the campaigns become too tough for me and my friends.

FLAWS
--- Presentation issue: Lack of cutscenes, and even when there were like in the Reduction campaign, they look unpolished and sometimes misplaced. Perhaps a sign of limited budget.

184003538.review:
TL;DR: 9/10
I've played a bit with randoms, but mostly with friends. Honestly, this is an excellent "party" game. I've not tried playing in person on a big screen, but for shooting the shit with some friends, I find it comparable to Guitar Hero, which is high praise. Plus, it runs on nothing. I first played this on an i5-6200U laptop from ~2016 and I doubt I ever dropped below 60fps. Anyway, I highly recommend picking this up, either to play with friends or (if you can find any open ones) hop into a lobby of strangers.

183653979.review: Something that blows my nuts off entirely is how this game is completely free and has NO microtransactions or live-service-slop. I suck at this game and have no friends to play with but even with the bots I can tell this is a surprisingly in-depth coop shooter with plenty of missions/gear/weapons/characters/enemies to toy around with. Give it a whirl I mean if you have like 4 dudes to game with then this could honestly be something y'all boot up often to gun down aliens with.
